oai_dc:dc.dc:title: President Frranklin D. Roosevelt, Eleanor Roosevelt, and Governor Hill McAlister
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: President Franklin D.Roosevelt, First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt, and Governor Hill McAlister seated in the back of an an open-air automobile. An unidentified man sits in the jump seat. Tall trees are in the background.

President Roosevelt visited Nashville at the invitation of U.S. Speaker of the House Joseph W. Byrns. The president's mission was to promote his "New Deal." Byrns, a Tennessee congressman, helped Roosevelt push through Congress many New Deal programs; designed to combat the Depression. The Roosevelts saw the James K. Polk and Sarah Childress Polk tomb at the Capitol; ate breakfast at the Hermitage Hotel; visited Andrew Jackson's home, The Hermitage; and made several stops in Madison.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Roosevelt, parade, Hermitage, Nashville
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wiles Studio
